attributes.action: UK Cities who voted "Remain" to be granted freedom to leave the UK & join the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum should never have happened.  The UK is a REPRESENTATIVE democracy ie we select and pay politicians to do the business of Government for us.  A decision so momentous should not have been handed to an electorate unqualified to comprehend the magnitude of the task.
attributes.additional_details:
The Referendum was about economics & trade. The media & certain politicians made it about blaming hard-working immigrants.

The EU Referendum was not supported by the educated or the young.  It was not supported by the cities.

London has a bigger GDP than many states. My city, Norwich, has thriving links with Europe as does Cambridge.  

We in the cities who voted to Remain in the EU see no alternative but to petition to be allowed to leave a country determined to commit economic suicide.

attributes.action: Impose a cap on tuition fees at £9000 for EU students until 2020.
attributes.background: Due to the result of the recent EU referendum, many EU students who want to study in Britain in coming years now face prices of up to £20,000 as they will be deemed as international students.  To make it fair for these students, we are proposing capping tuition fees until 2020.

attributes.action: That Non Stun slaughter be debated in Parliament.
attributes.background: I have researched what the doctrinal basis for Shechita is. We are in the new millennium and Shechita slaughter is no longer the most humane way to kill. When the Holy Prophet was alive, stunning methods used today did not exist.
attributes.additional_details:
The Food Research Institute state that killing an animal before it is bled out by high voltage electrical stunning does not affect the amount of blood lost from the carcass.  I have spoken to Jewish people on this issue they say they can see no reason why animals cannot be stunned first.
A witness to Shechita slaughter described a knife was drawn 17 times across a bullocks throat. A shock on his face as he tried to move away.

attributes.action: One copy of the British Bill of Rights for every household.
attributes.background: In anticipation of the UK government's desire to replace the Human Rights act with a British Bill of Rights, it seems vital that every citizen have available to them a hard copy version of the new document thus insuring they can know, with complete transparency, exactly what their rights are.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has a long history of enshrining the rights of it's citizens in law, from the Magna Carta in 1215 onwards we actually have a proud history of attempting (if not always succeeding) to insure human rights are protected in law.

In the interests of empowering the people that they should know their rights, and thus aid the government in insuring the public trust it's promise to uphold human rights, giving (not selling) every household a copy of the new document is essential.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for an employer to impose gender specific dress codes on staff.
attributes.background: Many companies have dress codes, or uniform guidelines, which their employees must follow. Many elements are based on gender stereotypes, and it is common practise to have different standards for male and female. Elements may include; headwear, shoes, skirts/trousers, make-up and hair styles.
attributes.additional_details: Most companies in the service and corporate sector have strict uniform guidelines that include elements like; Women must wear skirts, men must wear trousers. Women must wear make-up, men must not wear make-up. Women are allowed long hair styles, men are allowed only short hair styles. If an employee does not comply with the uniform guidelines, as per their predefined gender, the employee will be subject to disciplinary procedure which may include dismissal. The aim with this petition is to make it a legal requirement for the employer to remove all gender references in regards to company dress and grooming standards, and that any imposed standard may be followed by any employee regardless of the employees’ gender association.

attributes.action: Re-introduce so called 'carry back' of pension contributions (one tax-year only)
attributes.background: The ability for individuals to make a pension contribution and 'carry back' the contribution for one tax-year, will make it easier for individuals to avoid making excess pension contributions and suffering avoidable tax charges, under the new Tapered Annual Allowance. It will reduce HMRC costs too.
attributes.additional_details: Individuals potentially affected by the new Tapered Allowance will find it very difficult to judge whether they are affected and, if so, to what extent, until the latter part of the coming 2016-17 tax-year, making it difficult for these individuals and their professional advisers (accountants and financial planners) to decide what level of pension contribute they can make/receive without suffering a personal tax charge, until say March 2017. Re-introducing carry back will alleviate this problem.

attributes.action: Additional Bank Holiday in October
attributes.background:
From the end of August to the end of December, the UK do not have any bank holidays.
The UK have one of the least amount of Bank Holidays in the world.
I propose an additional Bank Holiday for the UK in between August and December.
attributes.additional_details:
Trafalgar is a popular choice and that was on the 21 October 1805. Nelson died but Britain prevailed. Trafalgar Day has a nice ring.

The Battle of Hastings was fought on the October 14 1066 so could also be around this day

attributes.action: Independent public enquiry to investigate the decision to cut ESA by DWP.
attributes.background: I believe that MP's were mislead prior to voting in favour of cuts to ESA. I believe that the Minister in charge of DWP at the time, told MP's in his own party that the cuts would only apply to individuals who could work. This is not true as if fit for work they would apply for JSA.

attributes.action: All illegal immigrants to be deported within 48 hours & a 10yr ban from a visa!
attributes.background: All illegal immigrants to be deported within 48 hours & a 10yr ban from a visa!
attributes.additional_details:
Illegal immigrants use £3.7billion worth of taxpayer-funded health and education services every year, 
Each one of them is taking advantage of Britain’s free NHS and schools and is costing the Treasury £4,250 per year on average.
This puts a huge strain on the NHS, Housing and Schools throughout the UK.
Make the only immigration legal to the uk to be pre-approved.
And any illegal immigrant to be deported within 48 hours.
With no new visa applications to be made inside the uk.
 without all the Red tape, we can instantly get rid of the people who should not be here! and also discourage all illegal immigration.
anyone one wishing to come to the uk should apply and be pre-approved for a visa or political asylum before they come.

attributes.action: End early release for 'good prisoners'. Expect, don't reward proper behaviour.
attributes.background: Currently it is not unusual for prisoners to serve half their sentence due to good behaviour. Such behaviour should be expected as a given in custody, not rewarded by time off. The sentence given should be served in full, and extended if the prisoner does not behave well whilst in custody.

attributes.action: Cap car insurance at a max of £700 for young/first drivers for cars upto 130bhp.
attributes.background: For many young drivers (who are mainly students) cannot afford silly prices insurance companies ask for. We do not deserve to pay thousands after being profiled. A max price should of £700 be set on cars upto 130bhp in order to prove to insurers that not all young drivers deserve to pay thousands.
attributes.additional_details: I myself a long with many others have been given quotes on e.g 1.0 cars upto £10,000! Even paying £2000 is alot in any case and I know people who have been paying that much with telemetry boxes fitted also. A Base price should be set.

attributes.action: Cut the International Aid Budget by 0.2% and use savings to  support UK Welfare.
attributes.background: The International Aid Budget is, in many cases, mis-spent. For instance supporting a strong economy such as India, & many others. We need to act to support UK Citizens in need of welfare support. This small reduction in the IAB will go a long way to meet the need to care for those in the UK.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single-use coffee cups
attributes.background: Over 500 billion disposable cups are manufactured globally every year and over one million of these disposable cups are discarded to landfill every minute. This has to stop! Please sign and share this petition as widely as possible and together we can force our government to act.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.keepcup.com/impact/fast-facts

attributes.action: Give People of England a referendum on creating a devolved English Parliament
attributes.background: It is fundamentaly unfair and unjust that England does not benefit from a devolved government on the same lines as other parts of the union e.g. paying of university fees, prescriptions, culture investment, the NHS, localised industries etc.
attributes.additional_details:
It is deeply unfair and an unresolved part of the British aprliament system in the United Kingdom how all constituent parts of the union except from England have some form of devolved government. 

it is clear these devolved governments have varrying degrees of power, but they enbale power to be decnetralised where it can be enabling a more localised and defined service being provided such as the education system in scotland and wales and the paying of prescriptions and university education.

attributes.action: Disclose any impact assessment for a Post Referendum exit strategy.
attributes.background:
Following The Prime Minister announcing the Referendum on UK membership of the political European Union the Government must have an impact assessment for either result. 

There has to be an exit strategy developed. The public need that information to make an informed decision on their vote.
attributes.additional_details: The Government have compromised the erstwhile impartial Civil Service and made them partial on this issue. It is time for the fair minded public to tell the Government their displeasure at this development.

attributes.action: Enable children from age 11 to be able to vote in the upcoming EU referendum.
attributes.background: This issue needs immediate action because the upcoming EU referendum will affect the children of the United Kingdom and their future. Surely we have a responsibility to ensure our children have a say for their future.

attributes.action: To provide adequate support and care for people with Multiple Sclerosis
attributes.background: To provide enough nurses and resources to support and care for people with Multiple Sclerosis.

attributes.action: We demand that the government seek to bring the railways into public ownership.
attributes.background:
The UK's rail network is state owned... but not by the British state. It belongs to no fewer than two other European governments! The rest of it is owned and ran by private companies.
Fares are rising year upon year. Quality isn't... 

We want a people's rail. A rail ran in people's interests
attributes.additional_details:
(a) The demand for public ownership: 

- Cross party support in the House of Commons for the Railways Bill since 2013. 
- 66% of voters support. (YouGov 2013)
- FOUR major transport unions back it. (TSSA, ASLEF, UNITE and RMT)

(b) The dire need for it:

-Rail fares have risen THREE times faster than wages in the last 5 years.

- Rail fares gobble up at least 13% of the average monthly pay packet.

- Fares rise year upon year. 25% since 2010.

- If nationalised, you could cut fares by 62p per £1

attributes.action: Patients who take anticoagulants should be given an option to self-monitor
attributes.background: Giving patients who take anticoagulants long term be granted an option to self-monitor at home with an INR blood tester. If we can test at home it can avoid the anxiety and disruption involved in going to hospital/GP, time involved with waiting for your appointments & the cost of transport/fuel.
attributes.additional_details: I had a PE 2 years ago & started taking anticoagulants, It was unknown if the PE had formed after an emergency C-Sec or due to a condition I have called Lupus, which is an auto immune disease. Due to Lupus my blood is not able to clot as fast as others. Weekly INR blood tests take their toll. 2 years on my veins are collapsing and serverly scarred. With a home tester this stops all the invasive tests, would cease costs of travel & hospital/GPS time. Like many others, get back to a normal life!

attributes.action: Make Google and other big businesses pay the proper rate of tax
attributes.background:
George Osborne has just negotiated a reported 3% tax rate for Google. Amounting to a £130 million tax bill for a company which made £6 billion in profits in the UK between 2005 and 2015.

In this age of austerity, we need individuals and big business to pull their weight.
attributes.additional_details:
This isn't the first time. While the government may defend their position, claiming to have made measures reducing tax avoidance, these companies agreed to a rate of tax when they began trading here, and should pay it.

While small to medium sizes business pay their fair share, and the self employed are penalised with fines should they fail to pay, big business such as Amazon, Google, Starbucks and numerous others get away with paying a greatly reduced sum.

attributes.action: Website matching homes to unaccompanied refugee children
attributes.background: In 2014 1,488 unaccompanied refugee children fled homes furthermore in 2015 2,168 a rise of 46% in one year. Government funding is requested for a website that speeds up the process for fostering unaccompanied asylum seeking children.
attributes.additional_details: The government is currently considering charities' calls for the UK to admit 3000 child refugees. There is a fostering process in place but this website will encourage the already growing desire to help the unaccompanied child refugees. It will be faster because it is all electronic with no papers involved.

attributes.action: Working families choice of 30hr funding at age 3 or 15hrs at 3 and 15 at 2
attributes.background: To give working families the choice of whether they want the 30hrs chilcare funding from the age of 3 in 2017 or if they want to split it so they get 15hrs from the age of 2 and 15hrs from the age of 3 has this would benefit alot of families more then the 30hrs from the age of 3.

attributes.action: Remove Southern Railway's Franchise For Causing So Much Chaos & Disruption
attributes.background: Repeated delays and cancellations due to low staff levels has left many late and stranded. With an over complaced complaints procedure, Southern Railway customers have been left out in the cold with slim chances of any compensation.

attributes.action: Add a capture code to the government petition site to prevent false signatures.
attributes.background: It is now common knowledge that the petition calling for a second referendum has been compromised. A hacker group is using a computerised bot to generate signatures. This petition should now be made null and void and all future petitions should have a captcha code, proving the signature is real
attributes.additional_details: There should also be a way of cross referencing the post code used, with the electoral register, to prevent miscreants from passing their post code for use to all and sundry.

attributes.action: Work with the other 27 states to reform the EU to an acceptable standard for all
attributes.background: It is not mandatory to act in accordance with a referendum. In the interests of peace, humanity and national security the Government should disregard the recent result, NOT trigger Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty but work with the 27 states to reform the EU in a way that is acceptable to all members
attributes.additional_details:
The first incarnation of the European Union was formed in 1957 by 6 countries, previously in conflict, to show allegiance to each other and prevent the further outbreak of war within Europe. 

On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted in a referendum to leave the EU and in the proceeding 5 days witnessed several disturbing acts of unrest and general tension as a result.

attributes.action: Teach children in schools about voting and parliament - primary school onwards.
attributes.background: After the recent referendum and outcomes of general elections I feel there's a clear need for people to be taught about the process, as well as learning to cross reference and rattify information to ensure they're making a truly informed decision.

attributes.action: We should have a referendum to quit NATO and save us from starting a major war.
attributes.background: NATO is not big enough to win a war against Russia, but large enough to start a world war.  This makes it a waste of tax payers money.  NATO has broken its agreement to expand beyond Germany, causing unease with Russia and making us impose US led sanctions, which have made UK farmers suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/601058/Britain-European-Union-Russia-Foreign-Policy-Agriculture-Farmers-Dairy-Phil-Hogan-Milk

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/french-farmers-block-roads-in-protest-at-huge-drop-in-milk-and-pork-prices-following-russian-trade-a6875581.html

http://www.southeastfarmer.net/section/news/eu-sanctions-hit-uk-fruit-growers

attributes.action: Form a National Unity negotiation team to immediately start negotiating with EU.
attributes.background: Post EU vote there is a vacuum and high uncertainty. We want to rapidly see the roadmap to clarity and then stability. The terms of our exit from the EU will last well beyond the term of this government. Therefore, a negotiating team reflecting many perspectives is required - a National Unity team.
attributes.additional_details: PM has resigned. His replacement's selection will take time. Shadow cabinet is fragmenting reducing the effective opposition. Scotland, N.Ireland and the young are bitter about the result. The break-up of the UK is a possibility. Markets are jittery. Now is the time for National Unity. Form our EU negotiation team quickly start the herculian task ahead. It should be led by Leave reflecting the people's will, but must be inclusive to reflect those in our society that feel alienated by the vote.

attributes.action: Teach anti-racist/bullying and self esteem building classes in schools
attributes.background: In this day and age we have come across more prejudice, xenophobia, racism and bullying.  This has escalated due to recent events.  In order for the future generation of children the most important thing a child should learn is respect for self and others.
attributes.additional_details: We must teach that bullying is wrong, tolerance for others is important for the process of peace. The current situation as we have discovered from recent events from voting out, has left our country in a state of racism, xenophobia and bullying.  We must act quickly to instigate peace and so that the new generation of Brits are tolerance, happier and peaceful people.  We have a country of British people of all races, religions, sexes and we must learn to live in peace and respectful of each other.  Bullying has been a major factor in all schools and the only way to diminish it is to build respect for self and others through classes and build their self esteem. This will have a positive impact for the future generation of British people no matter what race they are from.

attributes.action: Scrap charges at hospital car parks.
attributes.background: It is unfair and at times a dangerous practice to charge.  It is an essential service and causes problems for visiting routine and emergency appointments.  It causes unnecessary hardship.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland, Gibraltar, & possibly NI to inherit EU membership if they choose
attributes.background: That the UK voted to Leave whilst 1 territory and 2 nations voted to Remain poses obvious constitutional questions. The government should address those as a democracy, and offer apt constitutional arrangements (eg Scottish independence; others are more complex) which allow them to stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK's Brexit negotiations should allow polities to opt-out and inherit EU membership.

This avoids a gap between losing EU membership within the UK and regaining it under Article 49 accession.

Democracy (not Scottish nationalism) demands a referendum in Scotland.

New constitutional paths should be explored for Gibraltar and Northern Ireland that respect their links to UK, economic ties to EU and (esp NI) complex politics. 

Any changes should coincide with (and depend on) Brexit.

attributes.action: Allow a further EU referendum in 2018
attributes.background: We need a further vote.

attributes.action: Delay David Cameron invoking Article 50 to provide more time for EU discussions
attributes.background: 14,400,000 British people voted to REMAIN in the EU. These people cannot be ignored and by delaying David Cameron's invoking of Article 50 this would give the UK time to have more discussion with the EU and possibly come to a mutually beneficial agreement, such as Norway enjoy.
attributes.additional_details:
Voting figures taken from the BBC 2016 - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36615028

Information regarding Article 50 taken from The Guardian, 2016 - http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/23/eu-referendum-legally-binding-brexit-lisbon-cameron-sovereign-parliament

attributes.action: Greater independent regulation and oversight throughout buying a new home
attributes.background: Stressful enough, the process of buying a new house is fraught with legal traps and hidden charges for the consumer, where developers have free-reign to act as they please. Just like the majority of other industries, we need a body to provide advice to consumers and help when things go wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Buyers being forced to queue in the freezing cold overnight for the right to reserve a property should not happen in the 21st Century, and neither should waiting almost a year trapped, having legally exchanged contracts, to move in.

Thanks to schemes like help-to-buy it is getting easier for first time buyers to purchase, and new-build properties are the key. The NHBC is there to help when you've moved in, but we need an independent regulating body to help through the process of purchasing.

attributes.action: Repeal all legislation that inhibits absolute freedom of speech.
attributes.background: If, as is the case, the British people cannot vocalise or document any or every view that we may hold, then freedom of speech no longer exists. We may not like everything that anyone says or writes but we believe it is their right to say and write what they wish.
attributes.additional_details: One such objectionable piece of legislation is Clause 127 of the  Communications Act 2003.

attributes.action: Allow retirement with State Pension if people worked 40 years and contributed.
attributes.background: Loads of people have worked all of their lives and never claimed benefits, we now see retirement ages get further away. If they have worked all of their lives and paid taxes and NI  for 40 years  they should be allowed to retire with state pension irrespective of age..

attributes.action: The Government to start an official trial on the safety of e-cig/vape products
attributes.background: I have been a vaper for 6 years and feel much better than when I was a smoker.  I have not even had a cold for 3 years which means no trips to the doctors or prescriptions!!
attributes.additional_details: Although there may be dodgy products on the market...this can equate to dodgy iPhone chargers.  Exploding batteries....ever heard of mobile phones exploding/setting on fire.  E-cigs/vaping products need to be officially tested and for the scare tactics to stop once and for all

attributes.action: Make coloured (unnatural) hair and all piercings allowed in all schools
attributes.background: In most schools, unnatural hair colours and more than one piercing in each ear is not allowed because it's 'distracting'. However, its not. Students already cannot express themselves through clothing (uniform), so things like hair and piercings are the only thing left, and even that is not allowed.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair that students cannot have coloured hair and more than one piercing in each ear. In almost all cases, they get in trouble and/or suspended because it's distracting. Yet, what is more distracting? Having coloured hair and a few ear piercings? Or getting suspended from school and not receiving an education? Hair and piercings are a form of expression and creativity. School should be a place where students can freely express their personality, not forced to become someone else.

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers add a braille description of contents on food packaging.
attributes.background: This is a reasonable adjustment that will cost very little and aid people to have further independence.

attributes.action: Don't ban menthol cigarettes
attributes.background:
Plain packaging is coming into force and there is a proposal to ban menthol cigarettes. 


Menthol cigarettes makes up a large percentage of smokers and has existed for almost a hundred years.


Ban other flavours but make an exception for menthols like the US.
attributes.additional_details:
I thought all cigarettes were the same, so why treat some cigarettes different to others?


- Ban flavours, keep the menthol


- Halt any new anti-tobbaco law for at least 10 years 


- Don't allow cigarette prices to reach £15 by 2020

attributes.action: MPs should be paid the National Living Wage after regaining control of their pay
attributes.background: Many working people struggle financially on low wages. MPs are currently 'forced' to receive large salaries and pay increases by an independent body.  By reclaiming their right to set their own pay they could set it at the National Living Wage. This would encourage them to work for a fairer society.

attributes.action: Ethical consumption rating to be displayed alongside price for all products
attributes.background:
Our current consumption culture focuses on price. The true cost of buying that product is rarely reflected in the price.

The introduction of an ethical consumption traffic light system at brand level will enable conscientious consumers to easily make informed decisions about what they buy.
attributes.additional_details:
An ethical rating should be founded on the following core principles:
 -Environmental impact
 -People (wages, working conditions, exploitation of employees)
 -Animals (animal testing, welfare of animals)
 -Political activity
 -Product Sustainability (Organic, Fairtrade, Positive Environmental Features)

attributes.action: Provide funds for Hospices &Charities(Herriot Hospice- Hambleton&Richmondshire)
attributes.background: Herriot Hospice are ceasing to provide end of life care.Funding has been cut and the charity has had to subsidise up to 60%.It has been able to do this due to legacy, but this has been spent.It has decided to cease the service from 1/08/16 as it is not prepared to compromise on the service.
attributes.additional_details: My mother was diagnosed with cancer in 2014. Her wish was that she could stay at home to die. Herriot Hospice end of life care made this possible. These services must be allowed to operate with funding. My family are humbled by the services the devoted people provided and how they looked after her. Please help try to promote and share this petition.

attributes.action: More funding into Camhs and mental health in the uk
attributes.background: So many young people and adults do not get the care that they need for mental health. Young teens have to be inpatients miles away from there family. This is not fair on the families . There is not enough beds for adults. This is not fair on services . Camhs does not have the funding to help .

attributes.action: Teach touch typing in schools as part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: In our modern digital world, efficient use of keyboards is an essential life skill. My children have gone through the state school national curriculum in England and never received formal typing instruction. And as a parent, there was nothing I could do about it.
attributes.additional_details:
"It's no good expecting children to be able to produce a document quickly and accurately on a computer without giving them the skills to do it." http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/schools/why-its-cool-to-touch-type-1737511.html
"Touch typing allows us to write... at the speed of thought."
https://www.technologyreview.com/s/425018/out-of-touch-with-typing/
"Almost one third of British employers (30%) say they will not hire someone if they can’t touch type..."
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/ukschools/2014/09/02/new-research-reveals-why-typing-really-does-matter/

attributes.action: Stop the closing of Telford Town Centre walk in centre
attributes.background:
Telford to lose walk-in centre - 3,000 patients will need new GP practice
Telford will lose its town centre walk-in health service in a fortnight’s time, it was revealed today.

attributes.action: Reform the Commons: Three days full time with compulsory attendance for all MPs.
attributes.background: MPs should attend all debates, not merely turn up and vote or strike pairing deals. With other commitments, a five day Commons is not workable for MPs: I suggest three full days (9am to 6pm minimum), with one or two days for Committees, leaving at least one day for constituency work.
attributes.additional_details:
Reform is essential to improve the working of Parliament and improve the public perception of it and of politicians. All debates should be fully attended (except where civil duties take precedence). MPs who fail to attend without good reason should be fined, and repeat offenders  should lose their status as MPs. 
Clearly, other reforms are necessary, such as banning or limiting the odious tactic of filibustering. In addition, total recess should be no more than 30 days/year (like most jobs).

attributes.action: The Government should make contingency plans for an EU Referendum Leave vote.
attributes.background: H.M. Govt., like all responsible organisations, needs to look into the future and produce contingency plans for all potential outcomes which would significantly change the status quo, and which have a high probability of coming about. e.g.How will we get the best Trade Deal and Curtail Immigration?
attributes.additional_details: The Prime Minister has stated that, in the event of a Leave vote, he would want to stay in office to negotiate the best deal for Britain. It would be an abdication of his responsibilities for him to not start planning for this outcome now. There are many areas that need to be considered e.g. trade deals with non-EU countries, examination of EU rules and directives and their formal incorporation into UK law or abandonment, the recovery of our fisheries, UK subsidies to farming, etc.

attributes.action: £15 an hour and travel time for all carers
attributes.background: Some employees could be working an extra 10 hours a week once travelling time is counted..
attributes.additional_details: 7am to 10pm and we get paid a wage that we can't even live on. But if we don't care for the elderly.. Who's going to because most of them don't have family around them. Being a Carer is very rewarding but the pay and no paid travel time is horrendous. Mileage is not enough.

attributes.action: Replace regular public bins with recycle on the go bins throughout the UK.
attributes.background: Currently it is very difficult to recycle whilst out and about in public and it makes sense to add recycling bins onto the regular small black bins you see in the street. Scotland has rolled out 'recycle on the go' bins and the rest of the UK should too!
